newsitem.title: CHINA: China Q1 automobile sales up 9.32 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: China Q1 automobile sales up 9.32 pct yr/yr.

text.p: China sold 358,000 automobiles in the first quarter of 1997, up 9.32 percent from the year-ago period, the Market Daily said on Friday.
Sales had peaked in March, when car dealers sold 150,000 units, a year-on-year rise of 15.23 percent, the newspaper said.
Production of automobiles rose a year-on-year 6.21 percent in the first three months to hit 370,000 vehicles, the newspaper said.
China's carmakers still had 110,000 cars sitting unsold in storage by the end of March, it said.
"The present stock of automobiles is still a bit high," it quoted an official with the Ministry of Machine-Building Industry as saying.
Production in China's automotive sector has far outstripped demand, saddling the industry with whole lots of cars it cannot sell, analysts say.
About 91 percent of China's vehicle output was concentrated among just 13 firms, the newspaper said. China has more than 300 factories making whole automobiles.
Analysts have said output of China's flagging automobile sector has been far below capacity, with production of sedans running at just 45 percent of capacity.
